thread.title: Mets top Cubs again, take 2-0 NLCS lead
thread.title_full: Mets top Cubs again, take 2-0 NLCS lead

title: Mets top Cubs again, take 2-0 NLCS lead
text:
Mets top Cubs again, take 2-0 NLCS lead 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive Mets top Cubs again, take 2-0 NLCS lead October 18, 2015 Updated Oct 18, 2015 at 11:57 PM EDT 
NEW YORK, NY (21 Alive) - Daniel Murphy belted a first inning two run homer off Jake Arrieta, and the New York Mets went on to beat the Chicago Cubs 4-1 Sunday night to take a two games to none lead in the National League Championship Series. 
Murphy's homer, his fifth of the postseason, capped a three run first inning off Arrieta. 
Digital Daily â€“ subscribe to our daily newsletter 
The Mets also did it with their defense, as Curtis Granderson reached over the right center field fence in the second inning to rob the Cubs' Chris Coughlan of a home run. 
Kris Bryant drove in the lone Chicago run with a double in the sixth off winning pitcher Noah Syndergaard. 
The series moves to Chicago for Game 3 Tuesday night.
